alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Clay; Early; Quitman; Randolph (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 08 at 3:45PM EDT until August 08 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northern Dale County in southeastern Alabama... Henry County in southeastern Alabama... Northern Coffee County in southeastern Alabama... Clay County in southwestern Georgia... Randolph County in southwestern Georgia... Calhoun County in southwestern Georgia... Northern Early County in southwestern Georgia... Quitman County in southwestern Georgia... * Until 515 PM EDT/415 PM CDT/. * At 344 PM EDT/244 PM CDT/, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Davisville to near Glenwood, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Abbeville, Fort Gaines, Morgan, Georgetown, Cuthbert, Ozark, Fort Novosel, Edison, Arlington, Shellman, Ariton, Lee, Newville, Bellville, Haleburg, Bluffton, Shorterville, Parksville, Hayes and Camp Humming Hills. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Tallahassee.
